medical_history.chief_complaint: Extensive areas of purpuric erosions observed at birth.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was born with purpuric erosions, which formed a characteristic 'X'-shaped configuration on the back. The skin lesions healed over the next 3 months, resulting in atrophic and hypertrophic scars, with no new erosive lesions observed. Alopecia developed in previously affected scalp areas. At the 15-month follow-up, the patient's growth and development were normal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient's mother has systemic lupus erythematosus diagnosed at 17 years of age, controlled during pregnancy with medication. There is a history of one previous miscarriage.
medical_history.family_history: The mother has systemic lupus erythematosus.
